photo.description: Reenactors explain and demonstrate the weapons of the Colonial era at Castillo de San Marcos, in St. Augustine.

photo.title: Castillo de San Marcos - 03
Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos National Monument - July 1981

photo.description: outer walls of the fort overlooking the Matanzas River

There's something incongruent about this scene. The re-enactors interact with the tourist even taking their pictures. I'd have thought people would want their pictures taken with the re-enactors instead.

photo.title: Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos National Monument - July 1981

photo.description: The garrison marches towards the cannon on the Northeast corner of the fort to demostrate firing the cannon.

photo.title: Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos - Jessica & Jeb - July 1981
Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos National Monument - July 1981

photo.description: The re-enactors gather and begin to march up to the gun deck.

photo.title: Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos - July 1981

photo.description: Courtyard and the North wall. The central room on this curtain wall is the Chapel of St Mark.
With everyone gathered for the firing of the cannons, the rest of the fort is eerily empty. St. Augustine lies just beyond the fort.

photo.title: Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos - Jessica & Jeb - July 1981
Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos - July 1981

photo.description: The kid in orange I dubbed "Randy Jr". He had the same propensity for walking along the top of all the walls inside and outside the fort as did Randy.
Randy finds me in the crowd

photo.title: Florida - St. Augustine - Castillo De San Marcos - July 1981

photo.description: Cannon mounted along the seaward wall of the fort overlooking the bay
igniting the fuse
preparing the cannon for firing
They told us to cover our ears, but it was hard to capture this shot with my hands over my ears. I did suffer from ringing for several minutes afterwards.
Reenactment of Spanish soldiers firing cannons. St. Augustine, Florida.

photo.description: The British attempted to seize the castle twice; once during Queen Anne's War in 1702, colonists from Charles Town burned the town to the ground but failed to dent the fort. As similar siege in 1738 by General James Oglethorpe likewise failed to make a dent. Castillo de San Marcos National Monument, St. Augustine, Florida
photo.title: Cannons of Castillo de San Marcos

photo.description: Attacked many times, this fort was never taken by force. It was used by the original Spanish, the British and finally as a prison by the United States. It's a national park today.
